pullRequest.title: Deprecate set methods that should not be public
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
These set methods should never have been made public. They serve no purpose.
@timja @PauloMigAlmeida
Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time.

 Push your changes to a branch other than master. Create your PR from that branch.
 Add JavaDocs and other comments
 Write tests that run and pass in CI. See CONTRIBUTING.md for details on how to capture snapshot data.
 Run mvn clean compile locally. This may reformat your code, commit those changes.
 Run mvn -D enable-ci clean install site locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI.

nodes.bodyText:
Looks like jackson code is handled here:
https://github.com/github-api/github-api/blob/796c644c4ac0f4637b6289ed10a1ac8654c7d7b4/src/main/java/org/kohsuke/github/GitHubClient.java#L738
I assume it's doing field injection in someway?
I'm used to either constructor or setter binding with jackson, haven't seen this setup before
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -39,7 +39,9 @@ public GHUser getOwner() {
      *
      * @param owner
      *            the owner
+     * @deprecated Do not use this method. It was added due to incomplete understanding of Jackson binding.
